bill_title: restrict certain criminal liability for alcoholic beverage licensees and to provide for administrative sanctions.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict certain criminal liability for alcoholic beverage licensees and to provide for administrative sanctions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The licensee is not in violation of § 35-4-78, and no criminal penalty may be imposed on the licensee if: (1) The person making the sale in violation of § 35-4-78 is an employee or agent of the licensee; (2) The employee or agent does not own a controlling interest in the licensee; and (3) The licensee or person having a controlling interest in the licensee is not present at the time of the sale. Section 2. If a sale is in violation of § 35-4-78 and does not constitute a criminal offense against the licensee, the Department of Revenue may impose administrative sanctions against the licensee as follows: (1) Require the licensee to pay a civil penalty of three hundred dollars upon the first violation within two years; (2) The license may be suspended for three days and the licensee may be required to pay a civil penalty of five hundred dollars upon the second violation within two years; (3) The license may be suspended for fourteen days and the licensee may be required to pay a civil penalty of one thousand five hundred dollars upon the third violation within two years; (4) The license may be suspended for thirty days and the licensee may be required to pay a civil penalty of one thousand five hundred dollars upon the fourth violation within three years; and (5) The license may be revoked for a fifth violation within three years.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to restrict certain criminal liability for alcoholic beverage licensees and to provide for administrative sanctions. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. A licensee, licensed pursuant to subdivision 35-4-2(3), (4), (5), (6), (11), (12), (13), (16), (17), or (18), is not in violation of § 35-4-78, and no criminal penalty may be imposed on the licensee if: (1) The person making the sale in violation of § 35-4-78 is an employee or agent of the licensee; (2) The employee or agent does not own a controlling interest in the licensee; and (3) The licensee or person having a controlling interest in the licensee is not present at the time of the sale. Section 2. If a sale is in violation of § 35-4-78 and does not constitute a criminal offense against the licensee, the state's attorney for the county in which the sale took place may as part of any proceeding against the person making the sale request that the court require the licensee to pay a fine in accordance with this Act. Section 3. Upon a request from the state's attorney and notice to the licensee, the court shall conduct a hearing to determine if the licensee is liable under this Act, and upon a finding that the licensee is liable, the court may order the licensee to pay a fine not to exceed: (1) Three hundred dollars upon the first violation within two years; (2) Five hundred dollars upon the second violation within two years; and (3) One thousand dollars for the third violation within two years. Section 4. For the purpose of this Act, a controlling interest in the licensee means an ownership interest of ten percent or more.
